segments.en: Linked Discourses 45
13. Searches
170. Craving
“Mendicants, there are these three cravings.
What three?
Craving for sensual pleasures, craving for continued existence, and craving to exterminate existence.
These are the three cravings.

segments.pli: Imāsaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tissannaṃ taṇhānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya … pe … ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvetabbo.
segments.en: The noble eightfold path should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these three cravings.
What is the noble eightfold path?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ … pe … sammāsamādhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

segments.pli: Imāsaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tissannaṃ taṇhānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya … pe … ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvetabbo”ti.
segments.en: This is the noble eightfold path that should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these three cravings.”
Thirst
“Mendicants, there are these three thirsts.
What three?
Thirst for sensual pleasures, thirst for continued existence, and thirst to exterminate existence.

segments.pli: Imāsaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tissannaṃ tasinānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya … pe … .
segments.en: For the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these three thirsts …
… which culminates in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
… which culminates, finishes, and ends in the deathless.
… which slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.

segments.pli: Imāsaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tissannaṃ tasinānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya …pe…  ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvetabbo”ti.
segments.en: The noble eightfold path should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these three thirsts.”
